header.title: RAWN'S SELF-HEALING ARCHAEOUS ~ Lesson Seven ~ Astra-Mental Wandering
header.category: Western Esotericism, Hermetic Magic, Astral Projection

central_thesis: Safe and controlled astra-mental wandering (astral projection) can be achieved earlier than Bardon's IIH curriculum suggests by establishing a complete Elemental balance across the mental, astral, and physical bodies through the Archaeous process, which enables conscious separation and precise control, safeguarding against the dangers of less disciplined methods.

structure_content.summary: This lesson, building upon the foundational work of Archaeous Lesson Six and Bardon's IIH Step Four and Five, details a method for achieving safe astra-mental wandering. It emphasizes Elemental balance across the mental, astral, and physical bodies as an absolute prerequisite, contrasting with riskier 'popular techniques' that rely on raw energy. The practice involves replicating Lesson Six's comprehensive Elemental balancing procedure, followed by a concentrated focus on body unity and balance. The practitioner then cultivates a strong intention for astra-mental wandering, performs a conscious separation of the balanced astra-mental body, and practices controlled exploration of the immediate physical surroundings. Crucially, the process includes rigorous verification of astra-mental perceptions against physical reality to differentiate factual experiences from subconscious projections. Once reliability is achieved, the practitioner can expand their range of wandering, navigating primarily through strong mental intention and the principle of 'like attracts like'. Future, more advanced explorations into deeper astral layers are noted to require further alterations to the astra-mental body.

key_concepts.definition: The conscious separation and projection of the combined astral and mental bodies from the physical body, enabling travel to other locations or realms within the 'temporal present moment' or beyond.

A state of equilibrium of the four fundamental Elements (Fire, Water, Air, Earth) within each of the three bodies (physical, astral, mental). This balanced state is presented as the essential precondition for safe and intentional astra-mental separation and wandering.

Rawn Clark's system, presented as a series of audio lessons, designed to accelerate and refine the development outlined in Franz Bardon's 'Initiation Into Hermetics' (IIH), particularly focusing on achieving Elemental balance for self-healing and magical operations like astra-mental wandering.

Franz Bardon's foundational text in Hermetic magic, serving as the core reference for Rawn Clark's Archaeous system. Clark's work aims to meet student needs for astral projection 'in a quicker manner than Bardon suggested' while maintaining safety.

A perfected state of Elemental balance within one or all three bodies, which, when achieved in all three bodies, makes separation of the astra-mental body 'a matter of conscious intention' rather than relying on specific conditions or external forces.
The energetic link connecting the projected astra-mental body to the physical body. Its thinness and elasticity are noted as indicators of successful Elemental balancing and readiness for projection.

A principle of the mental plane, where a strong mental intention creates a resonance that, by the law of 'like attracts like', immediately draws the astra-mental body to the intended location, facilitating travel during wandering.

practical_system.description: The practical system for astra-mental wandering, as outlined, is a multi-stage process rooted in deep Elemental balancing and conscious control. It begins by replicating the complete Elemental harmonization procedure from Archaeous Lesson Six, ensuring equilibrium within the mental, then astra-mental, and finally the physical-astra-mental bodies through successive integrations. This foundational balance is followed by a period of meditation on the unity and equilibrium of the three bodies, culminating in the cultivation of a strong willed intention for astra-mental wandering. The operative phase involves consciously separating the Elementally balanced astra-mental body from the physical, maintaining immediate proximity, and focusing on internal balance and the silver cord. Initial exploration is limited to the immediate physical surroundings, with a critical emphasis on verifying astra-mental perceptions against physical reality to discern truth from subconscious projection. As proficiency and reliability grow, the practitioner extends their range of wandering, utilizing strong mental intention for navigation. Advanced exploration into deeper astral layers is hinted at as requiring further specific energetic alterations.
tools: Elemental balance cultivated through Archaeous/IIH system
rituals: Complete replication of Archaeous Lesson Six: Separation of the three bodies, then create Elemental harmony within the solitary mental body.
Integrate mental harmony into the astral body, creating Elemental harmony within the astra-mental body.
Integrate astra-mental harmony into the physical body, creating Elemental harmony within the physical-astra-mental body.
Spend several minutes deeply focused upon the unity of the three bodies and their mutual Elemental balance.
Focus upon the intention to astra-mental wander, building a very strong force of will into this intention.
Constrict awareness to the astra-mental body and separate it from the Elementally balanced physical body.
Stand very still next to the empty physical shell, focusing on the balanced state of bodies and usual astra-mental sensations; observe the silver cord's thinness and elasticity.
Turn attention away from the physical body and silver cord; focus exclusively within the astra-mental body and re-affirm its Elemental balance by gently accumulating and releasing the four Elements.
Turn attention outward to physical surroundings, maintaining control, resisting urges to 'fly off'; stand still until command is established.
Take a few steps around the room, examining details of physical surroundings with astra-mental faculties.
Stop, stand still, re-affirm astra-mental Elemental balance (accumulate/release Elements if necessary).
Turn attention to the silver cord and resting physical body, observing cord changes; re-explore physical surroundings, memorizing small details for later comparison.
Turn attention back upon the physical body, re-affirm astra-mental Elemental Balance, then re-enter the physical body.
Thoroughly integrate astra-mental body with physical body (as in Lesson Six, including accumulation of Elements into respective regions, release Elements, return to normal waking consciousness).

Immediately after regaining normal physical awareness, examine physical surroundings and compare astra-mental perceptions (especially memorized details) with physical perceptions to discern factual reality.
Repeat the practice of examining and comparing surroundings until astra-mental perceptions reliably align with physical reality.
Gradually venture further afield, viewing traveled places physically later to confirm accuracy of distant astra-mental perceptions.

relevant_quotes.text: Mastery of Archaeous Lesson Six is an absolute prerequisite for the pursuit of this Lesson since the Elemental balance is what releases the astra-mental body from its bonds and enables true wandering.
In order to safely astra-mental wander, there must be a state of Elemental balance within the three bodies.

As Bardon illustrated in IIH however, when an Elemental Equilibrium of all three bodies is achieved, separation of the Astra-mental body becomes a matter of conscious intention, instead of meeting certain conditions.
This whole procedure must be enacted very carefully and thoroughly, with special attention being given to the successive integrations.
You must be in control of it, instead of it controlling you. Stand perfectly still until you feel that you are in command and able to resist any urges to fly off.

The method by which you get from the location of your physical body, to any other point in space, is fairly simple. It's merely a matter of forming a strong intention to visit such and such a place. This creates a mental resonance which, because of the mental plane law of 'like attracts like', immediately draws you to your location of choice.

critical_analysis.relevance: This lesson is highly relevant for Hermetic practitioners, specifically those following or deeply influenced by Franz Bardon's 'Initiation Into Hermetics' (IIH). It addresses a common desire among students for safe astral projection by offering an accelerated methodology that prioritizes Elemental balance as a prerequisite, differentiating itself from what it terms potentially dangerous 'popular techniques'. It provides a structured, controlled path for astra-mental wandering within a classical Hermetic framework, emphasizing internal preparation and verified experience over brute force methods. The focus on integrating Elemental harmony across all bodies highlights a key tenet of Hermetic practice â€“ macrocosm/microcosm correspondence and the importance of inner purity and balance for external magical operations.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists of dedicated students of Hermetic magic, particularly those who have achieved a significant level of mastery in Bardon's IIH, specifically having mastered Step Four and making good progress with Step Five. It is explicitly stated as being for those already familiar with foundational Hermetic practices and internal balancing work. The lesson is for individuals seeking a safe, systematic, and controlled approach to out-of-body experiences (astra-mental wandering) within a magical developmental context, rather than for beginners or those seeking quick, ungrounded methods.
